thread.title: Michelle Williams and Emma Roberts wear identical dresses to the Oscars - but who wore it better?
thread.title_full: Michelle Williams and Emma Roberts wear identical dresses to the Oscars - but who wore it better?

author: Mirror .co.uk
title: Michelle Williams and Emma Roberts wear identical dresses to the Oscars - but who wore it better?
text:
Who wore it best? (Photo: Getty) Share   
There's nothing more embarrassing than bumping into someone who is wearing the same outfit as you. 
So when the entire world is watching, it makes it far worse. 
At Sunday's 89th annual Academy Awards, Michelle Williams and Emma Roberts wore near-identical dresses. 
Manchester By The Sea star Michelle, who was up for Best Supporting Actress, was sporting a plunging Louis Vuitton gown to the annual bash, while Emma stunned in an Armani ensemble. 
While they were not exact matches, the floaty skirt and deep-v necklines were very similar. Emma Roberts (Photo: FilmMagic, Inc) Nominee for Best Supporting Actress "Manchester By The Sea" Michelle Williams (Photo: AFP) Michelle Williams (Photo: AFP) 
Still, both ladies dazzled as they posed for pictures on the red carpet at   Los Angeles. 
Meanwhile, leading the best dressed list was model Karlie Kloss, 24, who looked radiant in a white asymmetrical Stella McCartney gown. 
The glamorous look, which featured a built-in cape, was perfectly complimented by Karlie's loose blonde waves and gorgeous chunky diamond choker. (Photo: AFP/Getty) (Photo: REUTERS) 
Chrissy Teigen also opted to wear white and looked a picture of perfection in her angelic thigh split white gown by Zuhair Murad. 
Ruth Negga, who is nominated for her role in Loving, in which she plays the real-life Mildred Loving, who was jailed for entering a mixed-race marriage with husband Richard in 1950s Virginia, opted for a bold red lace custom-made Valentino gown. (Photo: WireImage) (Photo: AFP) 
The high collar look, which featured a hint of lace and a little transparency, was definitely a head turner. 
Like Karlie and many others, the 35-year-old actress honoured the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) with a small blue ribbon pinned to her dress.
